intro: Eriope confusa, commonly known as the woolly sunflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its soft, fuzzy leaves and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its unique foliage and showy blooms make it a distinctive addition to botanical gardens. Eriope confusa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in arid conditions.
